summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2021 between a U.S. Attorney's Office and a Customs and Border Protection (CBP) Task Force Officer, discussing the verification and production of travel records for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell from 1997-2000. It includes specific travel dates and highlights the limitation of only having inbound arrival records for that period.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email chain is focused on locating and verifying his travel records (specifically inbound arrivals) for the period 1997-2000. Two specific dates are listed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email chain is focused on locating and verifying her travel records (specifically inbound arrivals) for the period 1997-2000. Six specific dates are listed, with notes about correlating outbound travel.

connections.description: Both are the subjects of a coordinated law enforcement request for travel records covering the same timeframe, indicating their activities are being investigated together.

events.title: Maxwell Inbound Travel
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell recorded an inbound arrival (per CBP records).

events.title: Maxwell Inbound Travel
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell recorded an inbound arrival (per CBP records). The period between 6/23/1997 and 8/6/1997 is noted as involving outbound travel.

events.title: Maxwell Inbound Travel
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell recorded an inbound arrival (per CBP records).

events.title: Maxwell Inbound Travel
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell recorded an inbound arrival (per CBP records). The period between 7/20/1998 and 7/24/1998 is noted as involving outbound travel.

events.description: Jeffrey Epstein recorded an inbound arrival (per CBP records).

events.title: Maxwell Inbound Travel
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell recorded an inbound arrival (per CBP records).

events.title: Epstein and Maxwell Inbound Travel
events.description: Both Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell recorded inbound arrivals on the same date (per CBP records).

keyFacts: Law enforcement (SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office) was actively seeking CBP travel records for Epstein and Maxwell in 2021 as part of an investigation.
The available CBP records for 1997-2000 only show inbound arrivals to the U.S.; outbound departures were not recorded during that timeframe, creating a data gap.
Specific inbound travel dates for Epstein (12/11/1999, 1/21/2000) and Maxwell (6/23/1997, 8/6/1997, 7/20/1998, 7/24/1998, 12/18/1999, 1/21/2000) were identified and correlated.
Epstein and Maxwell both arrived in the U.S. on the same date, January 21, 2000.
The document is marked Law Enforcement Sensitive/For Official Use Only, indicating the sensitive nature of the ongoing investigative work.
